original: Egrell, Gustav (Gösta) Emanuel, intendent, Göteborg, f. 23/10/84 i Upps. G. 1. 10 m. Nanny Albinsson, d. 18; 2. 22 m. Kerstin SchiLler. Barn: Gunnar f. 12, tj :m., Uppsala, Göran 15, disp., Tibro, Ingrid 17, g. m. ing. John Leve’11, Borås, — Mog:ex. i Upps. 05. Res. t. Fiml., Norge, Danm., Engl. o. Frankr. Tj :man i A-B Mälar-banken i Upp’S. 05-17, andre kamr. där 12-17, lär. i bokför, o. /ev .-teknik v. Upps. univ. o. tekn. sk.’’ 14-17, bitr. dir. f. A-B Nymans Verkst. i Upps. 17-21, verkst. dir. där 21-33, insp. i A-B Gbgs-Systemet i Gbg 34-37, intend. där sed. 38. Led. av stadsfullm. i Upps. 15-27, insp. f. Upp’s. stads yr.kessk. 29-33, led. av direkt. f. Ulleråkers sjukh. 30-33, led. av styr. f. Upps. Spritbol. m. fl. styr. o. ndr. Skr.: broschyrer i soc. o. in-dustr. frågor. RVO, RNS :t001kl.
translated: Egrell, Gustav (Gösta) Emanuel was an intendent in Gothenburg, born on October 23, 1884 in Uppsala. He was married twice, first to Nanny Albinsson for 10 years until her death in 1918, and then to Kerstin Schiller for 22 years. He had three children: Gunnar, born in 1912, who was a civil servant in Uppsala, Göran, born in 1915, who worked in dispatch in Tibro, and Ingrid, born in 1917, who was married to engineer John Levén in Borås. Gustav Egrell studied economics and technology at Uppsala University and Technical School from 1914 to 1917, and also worked as a teacher of accounting and business technology. He worked as a clerk at A-B Mälarbanken in Uppsala from 1905 to 1917, and was promoted to second clerk in 1912. He also worked as a deputy director at A-B Nymans Verkst. in Uppsala from 1917 to 1921, and as a works manager there from 1921 to 1933. He served as an inspector at A-B Gbgs-Systemet in Gothenburg from 1934 to 1937, and then became an intendent there starting in 1938. He was a member of Uppsala's city council from 1915 to 1927, an inspector for Uppsala's vocational school from 1929 to 1933, and a member of the board of directors for Ulleråkers Hospital from 1930 to 1933, as well as a member of various boards and committees. He also wrote brochures on social and industrial issues and was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa and the Nordic Welfare Society's medal of merit.

jobTitle.name: Teacher of Accounting and Business Technology

award.name: Nordic Welfare Society's Medal of Merit
